J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> What about Ant makes it difficult to manage widely-ranging dependencies and tasks? If Ant can do what make can do, when why is Ant any less suited to building the JDK/JVM than make?

Ant has the same issue JUnit has, it's downwardly dependent. By that 
I mean that an Ant toplevel project has to be told about its 
subprojects to run them, in the same way an AllTests has to be told 
about all the test cases to run them. Moreover Ant has to be 
explicitly told about the dependency graphs between projects and 
this usually involves shell scripts or some other wrapper around Ant 
and relience on the programmers to state the right build order. On 
the other hand, make is very good at resolving project dependencies 
with a minimal amount of information.

It's not a problem as such since Ant wasn't designed to be make with 
angle brackets.

Bill de h�ra
